meanings.definition: A place where plumes are kept or sold.
meanings.sent1: At the plumery, colorful feathers are displayed for sale.
meanings.sent2: I visited the plumery to buy some feathers for my craft project.
meanings.sent3: The plumery owner joked that their shop was a 'feather paradise'.
meanings.sent4: Her room looked like a plumery with feathers of all sizes scattered around.
meanings.sent5: The plumery smelled of sweet perfumes mixed with the earthy scent of feathers.

meanings.definition: The act of decorating with plumes.
meanings.sent1: Her plumery of a hat was the talk of the town.
meanings.sent2: Plumery is an art form that requires precision and creativity.
meanings.sent3: He took plumery to the extreme by covering his entire car in feathers.
meanings.sent4: The ballroom was transformed into a plumery of elegance with feather decorations.
meanings.sent5: The bride's dress was a masterpiece of plumery, adorned with delicate feathers.

meanings.definition: The business of dealing in plumes.
meanings.sent1: The plumery thrived in the Victorian era when plumes were in high demand.
meanings.sent2: She inherited the family plumery and continued the tradition of feather trading.
meanings.sent3: The undercover detective posed as a plumery owner to catch the illegal feather traders.
meanings.sent4: In the world of fashion, plumery is a lucrative industry.
meanings.sent5: The historical novel delved into the dark side of the plumery business in the 19th century.
